items.title: Indian e-scooter maker Ather converts shares ahead of IPO
items.summary:
- Ather Energy converted 173,000 compulsory convertible preference shares into 240 million equity shares on Mar. 8.
- The new shares have a face value of 1 rupee (US$0.0115) and will rank equally with existing shares.
- Current shareholders include Hero MotoCorp Limited and others.
- Ather expects to launch its IPO by April 2025, aiming for a valuation of around US$2.5 billion.

items.title: New and returning investors betting on SEA
items.summary:
- Some investors are returning to Southeast Asia's funding landscape after a six-month hiatus.
- Their renewed investments suggest confidence in the market or new ventures into the region.
- Identifying these investors can help startups target potential funding opportunities.

items.title: Saudi Arabia’s $8.8t Neom city faces delays, shortages
items.summary:
- Saudi Arabia's Neom project, a 105-mile-long city, faces substantial financial and logistical challenges.
- The project may take an additional 55 years to complete and could cost up to $8.8 trillion.
- Since its launch, the Neom initiative has utilized $50 billion of Saudi investment, exceeding 25 times the country's annual budget.
- Issues include labor shortages, infrastructure deficits, and energy supply problems.

items.title: Paytm issues equity shares worth $665k
items.summary:
- Paytm has issued equity shares valued at $665,000.
- The move is part of the company's financial strategy for raising capital.
- Details on the implications of this issuance have yet to emerge.

items.title: Foxconn unveils first AI model for manufacturing, supply chain
items.summary:
- Foxconn introduced 'FoxBrain', its first large language model for manufacturing and supply chain management.
- Trained on 120 Nvidia H100 GPUs for four weeks, based on Meta's Llama 3.1 architecture.
- Optimized for traditional Chinese and Taiwanese, capable of data analysis, decision support, document collaboration, problem-solving, and code generation.
- Initially for internal use; plans to collaborate with partners and share open-source elements.
- Training utilized Nvidia’s Taipei-1 supercomputer in Kaohsiung.
- More information to be revealed at Nvidia’s GTC developer conference later this month.

items.title: Saudi Arabia leads data center growth in Middle East: report
items.summary:
- Saudi Arabia is projected to lead data center growth in the Middle East, with a 37% CAGR through 2027.
- The growth outpaces Dubai, Abu Dhabi, and the global average of 15%.
- Expansion driven by digital transformation, AI ambitions, government incentives, and data sovereignty policies.
- Major tech firms like Microsoft, AWS, and Equinix are expanding in the country.
- Groq Inc. partners with Aramco to build an AI inferencing center.
- An AI project with potential funding of up to US$100 billion is in development to compete with UAE.
- Challenges include US export restrictions and rising energy costs.
- Saudi Arabia's young population of 35 million supports data center growth, emphasizing AI and innovation in economic diversification.

items.title: Canadian telecom firm Mitel Networks files for bankruptcy
items.summary:
- Mitel Networks has filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy in the Southern District of Texas.
- The company has assets and liabilities ranging between US$1 billion and US$10 billion.
- Mitel provides business phones and call center services, with a user base of 75 million in 2023.
- Acquired by Searchlight Capital Partners in 2018 for US$2 billion, aimed at enhancing cloud services.
- Attempted an “up-tiering” transaction in November 2022 to improve liquidity but faced ongoing core business issues.
- The bankruptcy filing presents significant challenges for the company's restructuring efforts.

items.title: AI cybersecurity startup Harmony secures $3m seed
items.summary:
- Harmony Intelligence has raised US$3 million in seed funding led by Airtree, with over 30 investors participating.
- The funding responds to the increasing threat of AI-powered cyberattacks.
- More than half of businesses in the US and UK have faced deepfake scams, with 43% being victimized.
- A case involving UK engineering firm Arup resulted in US$25 million losses due to AI deepfake technology impersonating executives.
- Harmony is engaged in cybersecurity testing for advanced AI models and has collaborated with international governments on AI safety initiatives.

items.title: Israeli startup CaPow raises $15m for energy-efficient robot
items.author: Professor Mor Peretz, Dr. Eli Abramov, Dr. Alon Cervera
items.summary:
- CaPow, based in Be’er Sheva, raised $15 million in Series A funding led by Toyota Ventures.
- Total funding for CaPow reaches $22.5 million.
- Founded in 2019 based on research from Ben-Gurion University, CaPow employs 34 people.
- The flagship technology, Genesis, enables robots to recharge while in motion using radio wave technology.
- Designed for large logistics centers, it aims to reduce downtime and reliance on traditional charging stations.
- The funding will support further development and deployment of the technology in industrial applications.

items.title: Mober opens Philippines’ largest EV charging hub
items.summary:
- Mober has launched the largest commercial EV charging hub in the Philippines, named Central Charge.
- The facility spans 3,000 square meters and includes 56 charging ports, featuring 50 7kW DC chargers and two 60kWh fast chargers.
- Central Charge can support up to 200 EV trucks daily through a three-shift system, reducing vehicle downtime and enhancing logistics for major clients like IKEA and Nestlé.
- Mober, which began transitioning to electric vehicles in 2021, is exploring options to incorporate solar panels and battery energy storage.
- The hub is part of Mober's plan to expand its EV fleet to over 500 units by 2026, reinforcing its commitment to sustainable logistics in the Philippines.

items.title: S Korean chipmakers uncertain as Trump slams CHIPS Act
items.summary:
- South Korean chipmakers, including Samsung and SK Hynix, face uncertainty after Trump's criticism of the Chips Act.
- The Chips and Science Act had allocated $39 billion to boost domestic semiconductor production.
- Samsung received $6.4 billion and SK Hynix $458 million for their projects in Texas and Indiana.
- Trump described the act as a "tremendous waste of money" and accused South Korea and Taiwan of harming the US chip industry.
- Concerns for Samsung extend beyond potential subsidy revocation as they build their US facility.

items.title: China’s top universities boost AI enrollments in strategy
items.summary:
- China's leading universities are increasing enrollments in artificial intelligence programs as part of their national strategy.
- The initiative aims to meet the rising demand for AI talent in the country.
- This move supports the broader goal of enhancing China's capabilities in technology and innovation.

items.title: Shanghai-based AgiBot unveils general embodied AI for robots
items.author: Peng Zhihui
items.summary:
- On March 10, 2025, AgiBot launched Genie Operator-1, a general embodied AI model for robots.
- The model utilizes the Vision-Language-Latent-Action (ViLLA) framework, enhancing scene perception and language understanding.
- AgiBot started mass production of humanoid robots in December 2024 and reached 1,000 units by January 2025.
- The company was co-founded by Peng Zhihui in February 2023 and specializes in AI chips and algorithms.
- AgiBot is backed by major investors including Hillhouse Ventures and BYD, which holds a 2.51% stake.

items.title: Trump pushes for stablecoin bill by August deadline
items.summary:
- President Donald Trump aims for stablecoin legislation completion by August, announced at White House's first crypto summit on Mar. 7.
- Trump supports legislative initiatives, highlighting the US dollar's crucial role and urging lawmakers to finalize a bill before the August recess.
- The summit featured key officials and crypto executives; however, critics pointed out the lack of diversity despite the attendance of women leaders.
- Prior to the summit, Trump issued an executive order to establish a Strategic Bitcoin Reserve and a US Digital Asset Stockpile.

items.title: Apple may launch its thinnest iPhone this year
items.summary:
- Apple may launch iPhone 17 Air, its thinnest iPhone yet, later this year.
- Estimated thickness between 5.5mm and 6mm, slimmer than iPhone 6's 6.9mm.
- Leaker Ice Universe reports a 6.9-inch screen, conflicting with earlier claims of 6.6 inches.
- Design includes a camera bar similar to Google Pixel devices.
- Features Dynamic Island, Face ID, USB-C ports, and consistent button placement.
- Details expected to be confirmed at Apple's annual September event.

items.title: Big Thai banks = innovation killers?
items.author: Simon
items.summary:
- Thailand's six largest banks control 82% of the commercial banking sector's loans and deposits.
- Banks have heavily invested in digitalization while waiving fees on online transactions.
- Startups find it increasingly hard to enter the market due to bank dominance.
- Three new virtual bank licenses are expected to be awarded this year, with analysts having low expectations for disruption.

items.title: Southeast Asia’s top-funded tech companies in the last decade
items.summary:
- Southeast Asia's startup ecosystem has produced major players like Grab and Sea Group.
- Researchers and investors are eager to discover which tech company will secure leading funding in the region.
- The article is part of premium content requiring a subscription for access.

items.title: Intel gets initial approval for private power plant in Israel
items.summary:
- The Israeli government has granted initial approval for Intel to build a private power plant at its semiconductor facility in Kiryat Gat.
- The decision is the first step in a regulatory process that may take up to seven years.
- The proposed plant would generate 450 to 650 megawatts, reducing Intel’s reliance on the national grid.
- The energy ministry found the project aligned with national electricity policies.

items.title: Samsung opens 2025 recruitment across 16 subsidiaries
items.summary:
- Samsung Group has started its recruitment for the first half of 2025.
- Applications are open online for one week across 16 subsidiaries, including Samsung Electronics and Samsung Display.
- Shortlisted candidates will take the Global Samsung Aptitude Test in April and interviews will be held in May.
- The recruitment is focused on experienced professionals and foreign science and engineering students to enhance workplace diversity.

items.title: Saudi Exchange tops Arab markets with $496.6b in trades
items.summary:
- Saudi Arabia’s Tadawul maintained its position as the largest stock exchange in the Arab world in 2024, holding 62% of the total regional market capitalization.
- The exchange recorded a turnover ratio of 247.1%, the highest among regional exchanges.
- Tadawul's trading value exceeded US$496.6 billion, contributing to a 58.1% increase in trading values across Arab stock markets, which surpassed US$1.03 trillion in 2024.

items.title: Saudi healthtech Future Vision to offer 20% shares in IPO
items.summary:
- Future Vision for Health Training, a Saudi healthcare education company, plans to pursue an initial public offering (IPO) on the Parallel Market NOMU.
- The firm will offer two million shares, which accounts for 20% of its total share capital.
- The share sale is scheduled for April 6 to April 10.
- Founded in 2019 in Madinah, Future Vision specializes in health education and training.

items.title: Saudi ecommerce sales via nat’l payment system surge 45% in Jan
items.summary:
- Saudi Arabia’s ecommerce sales via Mada cards reached 20.87 billion riyal (US$5.56 billion) in January.
- This reflects a 44.64% increase year-on-year, as per the Saudi Central Bank (SAMA).
- The number of transactions rose by 33.65% to 111.42 million.
- Retail sales at point-of-sale terminals hit 58.21 billion riyal (US$15.5 billion), up 8.19%.
- Restaurants, cafes, and food outlets saw the highest retail spending, while jewelry sales grew by 24.71% to 1.19 billion riyal (US$317 million).

items.title: AI cybersecurity startup Knostic raises $11m to secure AI tools
items.author: Gadi Evron, Sounil Yu
items.summary:
- AI cybersecurity startup Knostic raised $11 million in a funding round led by Bright Pixel Capital.
- The round included participation from SVCI, DNX Ventures, Seedcamp, and angel investors, totaling $14 million in funding.
- Founded in 2023 by cybersecurity experts Gadi Evron and Sounil Yu, Knostic focuses on securing generative AI tools in enterprises.
- Knostic's technology provides a real-time safeguard to ensure tools like Microsoft 365 Copilot comply with security policies and protect sensitive data.

items.title: Agentic AI Manus gains hype but faces early issues
items.summary:
- Manus is an AI platform developed by Chinese company The Butterfly Effect, gathering attention in its early preview stage.
- It has over 138,000 members on its Discord server since launch.
- The platform uses adapted AI models like Anthropic’s Claude and Alibaba’s Qwen for tasks such as report drafting and financial document analysis.
- Users have reported performance issues, including error messages, endless loops, factual inaccuracies, and inconsistent citations.

items.title: Japan’s service robot market expected to triple in 5 years
items.summary:
- Japan’s service robot market projected to reach ¥400 billion (US$2.7 billion) by 2030.
- Growth driven by aging population and labor shortages.
- Forecast indicates a labor shortfall of 11 million by 2040, with 40% of the population expected to be 65 or older by 2065.

items.title: Supply chain software firm gets unsolicited $15 per share bid
items.summary:
- Logility Supply Chain Solutions received an unsolicited acquisition offer for $15 per share on Mar. 7.
- This bid comes after Aptean's earlier proposal in January for $14.30 per share.
- Logility's board recommends supporting the Aptean deal advocated by TA Associates, Charlesbank, Insight Partners, and Clearlake.
- Logility, formerly known as American Software, specializes in supply chain management software.

items.title: Grab partners with autonomous tech firms for AV expansion
items.summary:
- Grab signed MoUs with Autonomous A2Z, Motional, WeRide, and Zelos to explore AV integration in Southeast Asia.
- Pilot studies will assess AV technologies for shuttles, cars, delivery bots, and buses.
- Objectives include improving safety, reducing accidents, and enhancing traffic management.
- Collaboration with governments and driver associations will support safe AV rollout and infrastructure development.

items.title: SenseTime boosts AI cloud with DeepSeek integration
items.summary:
- SenseTime integrates DeepSeek Enterprise module into SenseCore, its AI cloud platform.
- The integration focuses on enhancing performance, stability, and efficiency for businesses and developers.
- Launched LazyLLM, an open-source framework to simplify AI application development.

items.title: Global investors bet on SEA stocks amid US-China tensions
items.summary:
- Southeast Asian startups face a funding winter but Singapore and Malaysia stocks are thriving amidst US-China tensions.
- Investors are shifting supply chains to Southeast Asia, leveraging the region's cost-effective resources, as noted by Paul Chew from Phillip Securities Research.
- Craig Loveless from Norton Rose Fulbright highlights Southeast Asia’s potential as a long-term growth area due to its demographics.
- As of January 31, the MSCI ASEAN Index reports a 16% return, compared to the S&P 500’s nearly 22% increase.
- Singapore and Malaysia have demonstrated strong market performances, with the Straits Times Index reaching record highs in February, supported by sector gains and currency stability.
- Opportunities are emerging in Malaysia due to significant reforms and investments, according to Tan Altundag of Pictet Asset Management.

items.title: Aramco’s investment arm leads $30m series A
items.summary:
- Aramco Ventures led a US$30 million Series A funding round for climate tech company Spiritus.
- Funding will help Spiritus scale its direct air capture (DAC) technology to reduce carbon emissions.
- Spiritus CEO Charles Cadieu emphasizes the need to tackle carbon emissions while expanding infrastructure.
- Bruce Niven from Aramco notes high costs of DAC hinder widespread adoption and highlights the importance of innovative technologies like Spiritus's for decarbonization.

items.title: OJK reviews J Trust Bank’s report on fintech startup Crowde
items.summary:
- The Financial Services Authority of Indonesia (OJK) is monitoring a conflict between PT JTrust Indonesia Tbk (J Trust Bank) and fintech firm Crowde over alleged fund embezzlement.
- J Trust Bank filed a police report with the Jakarta Police Department on February 11.
- OJK announced on March 7 that it is conducting audits to address fraud risks in the fintech lending sector.
- Discussions and joint visits to borrowers are ongoing between J Trust Bank and Crowde to resolve the issue.
- J Trust Bank partnered with Crowde as a peer-to-peer lending platform to finance farmers, but internal investigations revealed breaches in their Cooperation Agreement (PKS) regarding loan disbursements.

items.title: UAE-based healthtech firm Klaim raises $26m for AI payments
items.summary:
- Klaim raised $10 million in Series A funding and an additional $16 million for expansion.
- The funds will support operations in the UAE, Saudi Arabia, Oman, and improve claims processing technology.
- Founded in 2019 in Abu Dhabi, Klaim uses AI and data analytics in healthcare payment solutions.

items.title: AI-powered ad startup Creatopy appoints new CEO
items.author: Tammy Nam
items.summary:
- Creatopy, an AI-driven digital advertising platform, has appointed Tammy Nam as its new CEO.
- Nam has previously held leadership positions at PicsArt and Viki, and will also join Creatopy’s board of directors.
- The former CEO, Dan Oros, will move to an advisory role.
- The company, founded in Romania, chose Nam for her background in scaling startups and expertise in marketing technology.

items.title: A letter to my younger self: Find what sets your soul on fire
items.summary:
[The article discusses self-discovery and personal growth.]
[It emphasizes finding one's passion and what truly motivates them.]
[Stories and reflections on the challenges and rewards of pursuing one's dreams are shared.]

items.title: TSMC plans to hire 8,000 in 2025
items.summary:
- Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co. (TSMC) plans to hire 8,000 employees in 2025 to expand production capacity.
- The company will visit 20 universities in Taiwan, starting with National Taiwan University, and conduct five online job events to attract talent globally.
- New engineers with master’s degrees can expect an average annual salary of NT$2.2 million (approximately US$66,875), which is well above Taiwan's average income in 2023.
- TSMC is seeking professionals in various fields including engineering, telecommunication, chemical engineering, finance, business management, and law for roles in multiple cities.
- The company has opened applications for its summer internship program, targeting master’s and PhD students, with top interns receiving potential full-time job offers.

items.title: Chocolate Finance suspends instant withdrawals due to ‘high demand’
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Chocolate Finance has temporarily suspended instant withdrawals due to high demand.
- Withdrawal requests will take 3 to 10 days to process, and once confirmed, cannot be cancelled.
- The company, founded in July, manages close to S$1 billion (US$750.8 million) in assets as of February.
- Founder Walter de Oude is also known for starting Singlife in 2014.
- Chocolate Finance specializes in investment opportunities for better returns and is licensed by the Monetary Authority of Singapore.

items.title: Australian AI startup Flowing Bee raises $1.6m for US expansion
items.author: Michael Sankey, Sara Khorasani
items.summary:
- Flowing Bee, a Melbourne-based startup, raised US$1.6 million for its AI-powered customer analysis platform.
- The funding aims to expand operations in the US, with plans to establish a presence in Silicon Valley.
- Founded by behavioral scientist Michael Sankey and technologist Sara Khorasani, the platform analyzes customer sentiment via AI and surveys to improve marketing efforts.
- Funds will also support platform refinement, emphasizing human oversight for data reliability.

items.title: Swiss private equity firm acquires Australian data centre
items.summary:
- Partners Group acquired GreenSquare DC for US$1.2 billion.
- The acquisition underscores growing international investment in data centres.
- Demand for cloud computing and AI infrastructure drives industry expansion.
- GreenSquare DC was founded in 2020 by Walt Coulston, who owned the company before the sale.
- The company operates a data centre in Sydney and additional sites in Melbourne and Perth.
- Partners Group has invested over US$4 billion in data centres since 2021.
- Industry growth is supported by tech giants like Microsoft, Amazon, and Google.
- Specifics on GreenSquare's clients and acquisition terms are undisclosed.

items.title: Australian AI medical scribe Heidi Health bags $16.6m in funding
items.summary:
- Heidi Health raised US$16.6 million in a Series A follow-on funding round.
- Investment led by US venture capital firm Headline, with participation from Local Globe and existing investors like Blackbird and HESTA.
- Announcement made during presentation at the HIMSS conference in Las Vegas, which attracts healthcare industry stakeholders.
- Founded in 2019, Heidi Health develops AI tools for transcribing and summarizing patient consultations.
- The software processes over one million healthcare consultations weekly without recording audio.

items.title: China’s Amiao Robotics secures $14m from Anker
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Amiao Robotics raised approximately $14 million (100 million yuan) in a funding round led by Anker Innovations.
- Other investors included Zhipu Z Fund and K2 VC.
- The funding will assist Amiao in developing intelligent solutions for industrial and commercial applications.
- Amiao’s founder, Liu Fang, has prior experience at Google China and Xiaomi.
- Anker aims to support Amiao in improving automation and expanding robotics use in B2B applications.

items.title: Google removes DEI terms from AI ethics webpage
items.summary:
- Google updated its Responsible AI and Human Centered Technology (RAI-HCT) webpage, removing terms such as "diversity," "equity," and "marginalized communities."
- The webpage now uses broader terms instead of focusing on underrepresented groups.
- These changes were first reported by The Midas Project; Google has not responded to inquiries.
- This update follows Google's decision in February to review DEI programs and cancel diversity hiring targets.
- Other tech companies are also scaling back DEI initiatives amid scrutiny from the Trump administration.

items.title: US Justice Department still calls to break up Google
items.summary:
- The US Department of Justice (DOJ) is pushing to break up Google, suggesting the sale of Google Chrome and possibly Android.
- A revised court filing claims that selling Chrome would enhance competition in the internet search market.
- The DOJ's update removes the option for Google to sell Android unchanged and drops a halt on AI investments; however, Google must inform officials of future AI moves.
- Google proposed a plan without divestitures, instead suggesting limits on preinstalled apps.
- A hearing regarding these proposals is scheduled for April.

items.title: US in talks with 4 groups over TikTok sale, Trump says
items.summary:
- President Trump announced on Mar. 9 discussions with four parties regarding the sale of TikTok, owned by ByteDance.
- This follows a law enacted on Jan. 19 requiring ByteDance to divest TikTok on national security grounds or face a ban.
- Trump stated the options are viable but did not disclose buyer details, saying all four parties are good candidates.

items.title: Stablecoins rise as Hong Kong becomes regulation hub
items.summary:
- Stablecoins, linked to traditional currencies like the US dollar, now make up 20% of all crypto transactions.
- US dollar-backed stablecoins have a global market cap of around US$200 billion.
- Hong Kong is becoming a prominent market for stablecoin activities due to its US dollar peg and strong banking sector.
- Hong Kong plans to introduce regulations for stablecoins to enhance oversight amid rising global demand.

items.title: Chinese humanoid robotics startups raised $276m in early 2025
items.summary:
- China's humanoid robotics market raised US$276 million across 20 deals in early 2025.
- This is a significant increase from US$176 million raised in the same period last year.
- According to Morgan Stanley, 56% of the world’s humanoid robotics companies are based in China.
- China is set to begin mass production and commercialization of humanoid robots this year.
- Startups like LimX Dynamics, AI2Robotics, and Eyoubot secured funding, indicating rapid sector growth.

items.title: US regulator clears path for banks’ crypto activities
items.summary:
- US regulators have cleared the way for banks to engage in cryptocurrency activities.
- The decision aims to provide clearer guidelines and support for financial institutions exploring crypto.
- This regulatory move is expected to enhance the adoption of digital currencies and improve market stability.

items.title: Glasswall: The things anonymous founders say about VCs
items.summary:
- The article discusses how anonymous founders review venture capitalists (VCs).
- It highlights various perceptions and experiences of founders regarding VCs.
- Founders provide insights into the traits they value in VCs based on their interactions.

items.title: Apple delays Siri AI personalization updates to 2026
items.summary:
- Apple has delayed AI features for Siri to 2026, originally scheduled for 2025.
- The updates aim to enhance Siri’s personalization and contextual awareness.
- Siri will gain access to personal data to offer tailored recommendations.
- Apple cited a longer-than-expected development process for the delay.
- Siri processes 1.5 billion requests daily, competing with Google’s Assistant and Amazon’s Alexa.

items.title: China to implement AI courses in schools
items.summary:
- Beijing will introduce AI courses for primary and secondary students starting **Sept. 1, 2025**.
- Schools are required to provide at least **eight hours** of AI education each year.
- AI education can be standalone or integrated into subjects like **information technology** and **science**.
- The initiative aims to strengthen China's role in the **global AI sector**.
- The government's support for large-scale AI model development was reaffirmed at the **National People’s Congress**.
- Huai Jinpeng, the education minister, highlighted AI’s role in driving innovation in education.
- A **white paper** on AI in education is expected later this year.

items.title: Digital therapy firm Hinge Health plans IPO in April
items.summary:
- Hinge Health, a digital physical therapy company, is preparing to file for an IPO soon with a target listing by April.
- Founded in 2014, the startup specializes in virtual musculoskeletal therapy and pain management devices.
- The company reported $390 million in revenue for 2024, $45 million in free cash flow, and has gross margins of about 78%.
- Valued at $6.2 billion in 2021, Hinge Health has raised over $1 billion in funding from investors like Tiger Global and Coatue Management.
- The physical therapy market is expected to grow to $70 billion by the end of the decade, with Hinge Health being four times larger than its closest competitor, Sword Health.
- Advancements in AI have contributed to the expansion and scalability of Hinge Health's care team.
